{{Coord|51.6375|-2.1564|display=title|region:GB_scale:5000}} The '''Tetbury Woolsack Races''' are held on the [[Whitsun]] Bank Holiday Monday. Hundreds of people line up along Gumstool Hill (an extremely steep street) in the centre of [[Tetbury]], [[Gloucestershire]] to watch the teams. Each competitor must carry a full woolsack on his / her back and race either up, down or up and down the hill.
The races take place between two [[public house]]s, the Royal Oak (the bottom of the hill) and the Crown (at the top). People can take part either as individuals or as part of a team. The individuals race up the hill, the teams (with 4 members swapping places at each end of the course) race up and down the hill twice.
The men race with a 60 lb woolsack, ladies have 30 lb. There are also youth races where boys ages 16–18 races with a 30 lb sack and a children's class. The weight of the children's woolsack isn't specified but it's probably about the same as a pillow.
Regular competitors include local [[rugby football|rugby]] teams, the [[British Army]] and the Norfolk Mountain Rescue Team.
==History== This website contains information from the 2002 and 2003 Woolsack Races: [https://web.archive.org/web/20060823005003/http://www.tetburyonline.co.uk/events/woolsack02.htm Link]
==External links== *[http://www.tetburywoolsack.co.uk Official Woolsack Day website] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20090520123559/http://www.bbc.co.uk/gloucestershire/our_crazy_county/woolsack_races/ BBC Gloucestershire coverage of the Tetbury Woolsack Races] *[http://www.bbc.co.uk/gloucestershire/content/articles/2007/05/29/woolsack_2007_feature.shtml BBC Gloucestershire feature on the Tetbury Woolsack Races 2007]
[[Category:Tourist attractions in Gloucestershire]] [[Category:Individual sports]]

{{Infobox video game |title = Wild Cup Soccer |image = Amiga Wild Cup Soccer cover art.jpg |caption = Amiga cover art |developer = [[Krisalis Software|Teque London]] |publisher = [[Guerrilla Cambridge|Millennium Interactive]] |producer = Tony Fagelman
Tony Love |designer = Ian Saunter
Mark Rafter |programmer = Paul Stapley
Peter Jefferies |artist = Tony Hager |composer = Steve Morgan |series = ''Brutal Sports Series'' |platforms = [[Amiga]], [[Amiga CD32]] |released = {{vgy|1994}} |genre = [[Sports game|Sports]] |modes = [[Single-player video game|Single-player]], [[Multiplayer video game|multiplayer]] (up to two players) }} '''''Wild Cup Soccer''''' is a [[Arcade game|arcade-style]] [[Association football|soccer]] [[video game]] developed by [[Krisalis Software|Teque London]] and published by [[Guerrilla Cambridge|Millennium Interactive]] for the [[Commodore International|Commodore]] [[Amiga]] and [[Amiga CD32]] in {{vgy|1994}}. It is the second and last entry in the ''Brutal Sports Series'' [[List of video game franchises|franchise]], which started with ''[[Brutal Sports Football]]'' in {{vgy|1993}}. == Release == A conversion of the game was in development and planned to be published by [[Telegames]] for [[Atari Jaguar]] in February/April 1995, however, it was never released.{{cite web|url=http://www.atarihq.com/jeo/archive.htm|title=Atari Explorer Online - Volume 4, Issue 1|website=atarihq.com|date=January 16, 1995|accessdate=2018-09-24}}{{cite magazine|last=|first=|url=https://retrocdn.net/index.php?title=File%3AUltimateFutureGames_UK_02.pdf&page=50|title=Jaguar Roars With Telegames|magazine=[[Future plc|Ultimate Future Games]]|issue=2|publisher=[[Future plc|Future Publishing]]|date=January 1995|page=50}}{{cite magazine|last=|first=|url=http://retrosprite.proboards.com/post/30/thread|title=Jaguar Roars With Telegames|magazine=[[Future plc|Ultimate Future Games]]|issue=5|publisher=[[Future plc|Future Publishing]]|date=April 1995|page=42}}{{cite web|last=Reutter|first=Hans|url=http://www.cyberroach.com/jaguarcd/html/wildcup.htm|title=Unreleased Or Unfinished Jaguar Games - Wild Cup Soccer|website=cyberroach.com|accessdate=2018-09-24}} ==See also== *[http://hol.abime.net/1710 Hall of Light] *[http://www.lemonamiga.com/games/details.php?id=2611 Lemon Amiga] == References == {{reflist}} == External links == * [https://gamefaqs.gamespot.com/amiga/931138-wild-cup-soccer ''Wild Cup Soccer''] at [[GameFAQs]] * [https://www.giantbomb.com/wild-cup-soccer/3030-6387/ ''Wild Cup Soccer''] at [[Giant Bomb]] * [https://www.mobygames.com/game/wild-cup-soccer ''Wild Cup Soccer''] at [[MobyGames]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Wild Cup Soccer}} [[Category:1994 video games]] [[Category:Amiga games]] [[Category:Association football video games]] [[Category:Cancelled Atari Jaguar games]] [[Category:CD32 games]] [[Category:Fantasy sports video games]] [[Category:Multiplayer and single-player video games]] [[Category:Science fiction video games]] [[Category:Sports in fiction]] [[Category:Video games developed in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Video games set in the future]]
